items.title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- A court granted a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration from dismantling the CFPB while the case is decided.
- Judge Amy Berman Jackson expressed concerns about the risk of destruction of the agency and stated that it would be impossible to rebuild.
- The ruling is a significant victory for the federal workers' union and groups dependent on the CFPB's protections.
- The Trump administration's actions are alleged to violate constitutional separation of powers and have left consumers without adequate financial recourse.
- The judge criticized the government's inconsistent statements about the status of CFPB workers and was not confident in their trustworthiness.
- The CFPB is ordered to reinstate terminated employees and maintain agency data, allowing them to continue operations for the time being.

items.title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Microsoft is removing the bypassnro.cmd script in Windows 11 Insider Preview to enforce Microsoft account login during setup.
- This is aimed at increasing security and ensuring all users have internet connectivity during the setup process.
- Current workarounds, like registry edits or unattended.xml automation, may not be viable for long as Microsoft tightens restrictions on installations and upgrades to Windows 11.

items.title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's AI company xAI has acquired the social media platform X in an all-stock deal valued at $33 billion.
- The transaction also values xAI at $80 billion, including $12 billion in debt from Musk's earlier acquisition of Twitter.
- Musk has emphasized the integration of xAI's capabilities with X, claiming it will enhance data access and business growth.

items.title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduces the Quick Machine Recovery feature to help restore PCs that fail to boot.
- This initiative aims to prevent widespread outages similar to those caused by a previous Crowdstrike update.
- The feature was announced on March 28, 2025.

items.title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate to a Google account to February 2, 2026.
- Users will lose access to Fitbit services and historical data after the migration deadline unless they transition to a Google account.
- Fitbit users have the option to download or delete their data before the deadline.

items.title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Metals Company (TMC) seeks to initiate deep-sea mining, potentially with U.S. support under Trump administration.
- In 2021, Nauru sponsored TMC, pushing for regulations to allow mining of ocean minerals for batteries.
- Environmental concerns arise regarding the impact on ocean ecosystems and coastal communities.
- TMC plans to apply for U.S. permits, claiming to comply with international law despite critics' objections.
- Critics, including Greenpeace and Deep Sea Conservation Coalition, oppose mining efforts without adequate regulations.
- Recent scientific studies highlight potential risks of deep-sea mining, including threats to marine life and ecosystems.

items.title: MrBeast co-wrote a book with James Patterson
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- MrBeast co-wrote a thriller novel with James Patterson, author of the Alex Cross series.
- The book, which is untitled, has attracted eight-figure bids for its publishing rights.
- The plot involves players fighting to survive deadly tests in dangerous locations worldwide, similar to the concept of Squid Game.
- MrBeast has incorporated Squid Game-like themes in his viral YouTube videos and recently launched the reality show Beast Games, featuring a $5 million prize.
- Film and TV rights to the novel are reportedly being negotiated.

items.title: Lenovo’s upcoming SteamOS handheld will cost $50 more than expected
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The SteamOS-powered Lenovo Legion Go S handheld was announced at CES 2025 with an initial price of $499.99.
- The pre-order price is now $549.99, confirmed by Lenovo’s communications director.
- Features include Hall effect joysticks, an 8-inch screen with variable refresh rate, but performance is not impressive compared to the Steam Deck.

items.title: Side Quest’s creators wanted to tell stories about why people love games
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus’ new miniseries, *Side Quest*, is a spinoff of *Mythic Quest*, focusing on players’ stories rather than creators.
- Co-creators Ashly Burch, John Howell Harris, and Katie McElhenney aim to explore relationships with popular games through different character perspectives.
- The series consists of four episodes, with a theme resembling the earlier *Mythic Quest* episode “A Dark Quiet Death.”
- The episode “The Last Raid” reflects on real-world friendships and gaming experiences, inspired by classic machinima like *Red vs. Blue*.
- All episodes of *Side Quest* are available for streaming on Apple TV Plus.

items.title: ChatGPT’s Ghibli filter is political now, but it always was
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- The White House used AI-generated images in a controversial post featuring a crying detainee, linking it with ChatGPT's Ghibli filter.
- The incident reflects a troubling intertwining of generative AI technology and political messaging, particularly amidst Trump's administration.
- OpenAI's Ghibli filter raises ethical concerns as it appropriates the style of renowned filmmaker Hayao Miyazaki, who opposes AI-generated art.

items.title: YouTube tests turning off notifications for channels you don't watch
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- YouTube is testing disabling push notifications for frequently updating channels that users don't open notifications for.
- The test specifically targets channels users have notifications set to "all." Notifications for less active channels will remain unaffected.
- There is uncertainty if users will be notified about missed alerts, with concerns over platform control of user notifications.
- The test is described as a small experiment with no details on duration or potential wider rollout.

items.title: Google to pay $100 million to settle 14-year-old advertising lawsuit
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google will pay $100 million to settle a class action lawsuit regarding misleading ad charges.
- The lawsuit, filed in 2011, alleged Google charged for clicks on ads placed outside specified geographical locations.
- The settlement requires court approval and includes advertisers who used Google Ads between June 1, 2009, and December 13, 2012.
- The case involved reviewing over 910,000 pages of documents and extensive data from Google.
- Google faced other legal challenges including federal antitrust lawsuits concerning its advertising practices.

items.title: Musk threatens to sic the government on people ‘pushing’ Tesla ‘propaganda’
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Elon Musk threatens to target individuals he views as spreading negative propaganda about Tesla amid rising protests against the company.
- The protests, labeled "Tesla Takedown," reflect opposition to Musk's political actions and policies, leading to large demonstrations at Tesla locations across the U.S.
- Musk expressed concerns about the impact of propaganda from the far left on those arrested for vandalism against Tesla properties, creating ambiguity about the treatment of peaceful protesters.

items.title: Here are the best streaming service deals available right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- 2025 offers great new TV shows and movies on subscription services.
- Various streaming services have ongoing promotions for new and returning subscribers.
- Examples of deals include:
  - Disney Plus: Four months for $2.99/month, normally $10.99, available until March 30.
  - Hulu: Four months of Hulu and Disney Plus for $2.99/month, down from $10.99.
  - Sling TV: First month at half price for new subscribers.
- Student discounts available on Hulu, Paramount Plus, YouTube TV, and Amazon Prime.
- Free trials offered by many platforms (requires credit card info).

items.title: A beginner’s guide to using Signal
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Signal is a messaging app focused on privacy and secure communication.
- Communication is end-to-end encrypted by default, ensuring message privacy.
- Signal does not store much user data, protecting against law enforcement inquiries.
- Unlike some services, Signal only retains the account creation and last usage timestamps.
- The app is accessible to anyone but is particularly valued by journalists and activists.
- Users need the app on both sides of a conversation to communicate securely.
- Signal provides disappearing messages and additional privacy settings to enhance security.

items.title: Here’s what military planning usually looks like — and why it doesn’t include Signal
items.author: Matthew Gault
items.summary:
- The Trump administration used a Signal group chat to plan a military strike in Yemen, which included classified details about American assets.
- National Security Advisor Mike Waltz mistakenly invited an *Atlantic* editor into the chat, leading to a leak of sensitive information.
- Military security protocols require secure communications in SCIFs, not unsecured apps like Signal, which are considered insufficient.
- Discussion of military operations should occur in secured facilities to prevent surveillance by foreign intelligence agencies.
- The Pentagon prohibits using unmanaged messaging apps on government devices to protect sensitive information.
- If devices are compromised, the benefits of Signal's encryption can be rendered useless, exposing sensitive data.
- The incident raises concerns about the potential for critical military operations to be discussed in insecure environments and the risks of interception by adversaries.

items.title: King Arthur wants to automate your sourdough starter
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The Sourdough Sidekick is a countertop appliance that automates the feeding of sourdough starter.
- It is a project by FirstBuild and King Arthur Baking Company, currently fundraising on [Indiegogo](https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sourdough-sidekick#/).
- The device allows precise scheduling to ensure the starter is ready when needed, utilizing a microfeeding schedule to reduce waste.
- The Sidekick costs $129 or $249 for a pair, with delivery estimated in January 2026 as it's still in prototype stage; it only ships to the US.

items.title: Trump pardons ex-Nikola CEO Trevor Milton
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Trevor Milton, founder of Nikola Motors, was pardoned by President Donald Trump.
- Milton was convicted of defrauding investors and sentenced to four years in prison.
- He appealed his conviction and announced his freedom in a video.
- Nikola faced significant scrutiny after a report accused it of fraud, leading to Milton's arrest and the company's subsequent bankruptcy.
- Trump's pardon follows similar actions for other controversial figures in the transportation sector.

items.title: Google’s Pixel 9A will launch on April 10th
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google is releasing the Pixel 9A in the US, Canada, and the UK on April 10th.
- The launch was delayed to address a component quality issue.
- It will be available in Europe on April 14th and in several other countries on April 16th.
- Preorders are not yet available, but users can sign up for notifications.
- The starting price is $499, featuring a larger display, upgraded Tensor G4 chip, and a new design with a flat back.

items.title: NASA and Boeing investigate Starliner’s ‘anomalies’ before its next crewed flight
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- NASA and Boeing are addressing technical issues in the Starliner before its next flight, anticipated in late 2025 or early 2026.
- Anomalies with the Starliner's thruster, valve, and helium systems delayed its ability to return astronauts.
- Postflight data analysis and testing of thrusters and helium system seals are currently in progress to resolve these issues.

items.title: Helldivers 2 is locking out players who use older CPUs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Players of Helldivers 2 with older CPUs are being locked out due to a requirement for AVX2 support.
- This AVX2 requirement, introduced by Arrowhead Game Studios and Sony, was previously not enforced.
- Many players, having invested significant game time, are frustrated and seeking refunds.
- There are concerns regarding PCs that cannot be upgraded, leaving players needing new systems.
- Sony previously imposed unpopular changes on PC players, including PSN account requirements, before retracting them.

items.title: First Alert’s new smart smoke alarm is meant to be a Google Nest Protect replacement
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- First Alert launched a new line of smart smoke and carbon monoxide alarms compatible with Google Home, following the discontinuation of Nest Protect.
- The Smart Smoke & CO Alarms are priced at $129.99 and come in hardwired or battery-powered options.
- They feature advanced sensing technology, interconnection with existing Nest Protect alarms, and a notification system for non-connected alarms.
- Automatic safety checkups, early warnings, and app alerts are included, but they lack presence sensor functionality found in Nest Protect.
- The alarms use First Alert’s Precision Detection technology and work exclusively with Google apps, phasing out earlier models.
- Plans regarding compatibility with the Matter smart home standard remain uncertain.
[Read more here](https://www.theverge.com/news/638234/first-alert-smart-smoke-alarm-google-nest-protect-replacement)

items.title: Yale’s new smart lock can match your Google Nest doorbell
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Yale has introduced a new smart lock that integrates with Google Home and is compatible with Google’s Nest video doorbells.
- The lock uses Matter-over-Thread compatibility, which allows it to work with multiple platforms including Apple Home and Amazon Alexa.
- This smart lock is a full deadbolt replacement priced at $170, and it will be available in gray, white, and black finishes this summer.
- It operates on four AA batteries with up to 12 months of battery life.
- The lock lacks built-in Wi-Fi but can connect to Wi-Fi through a separate Yale Connect Wi-Fi Bridge.
- Through Matter, users can manage access codes and guest access, along with receiving notifications and viewing lock activity history.
- Yale plans to discontinue the Nest x Yale Lock, which originally launched in 2018; however, existing devices will continue to receive updates.

items.title: Google discontinues Nest Protect smoke alarm and Nest x Yale door lock
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Google has announced the discontinuation of the [Nest Protect Smart Smoke and CO alarm](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/8836598/type/dlg/https://store.google.com/product/nest_protect_2nd_gen?hl=en-US) and [Nest x Yale smart door lock](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/8836598/type/dlg/https://store.google.com/product/nest_x_yale_lock?hl=en-US).
- The Nest Protect, launched in 2013, has faced availability issues, with limitations on purchases and slow shipping from the Google store.
- Google cites the need to refine its device portfolio and move towards a platform for device makers and developers.
- The Nest Protect will still receive updates and support until its expiration date, which is 10 years from manufacturing.
- A new replacement, the First Alert Smart Smoke & Carbon Monoxide Alarm, will be launched later this year for $129, compatible with existing Nest devices.
- Google is also discontinuing the Nest x Yale lock, which will receive software updates and management features via the Google Home app.
- A new Yale Smart Lock with Matter is being developed to complement the Google Nest doorbell, priced at $170, fitting into various smart home ecosystems.

items.title: In Baby Steps, I stumbled through a refreshing kind of open world
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Developed by Bennett Foddy, Maxi Boch, and Gabe Cuzzillo, the game features a slacker named Nate navigating a bizarre world.
- Gameplay involves controlling Nate's legs individually to take steps, making movement a challenging experience.
- Players encounter obstacles like staircases and logs, requiring careful timing and placement of steps.
- The game emphasizes 'self guided play' with no artificial obstacles, health, or death mechanics.
- Falling typically results in new areas being revealed instead of punishing setbacks.
- Similar to games like Death Stranding and Breath of the Wild, it focuses on exploration without a quest structure.
- Baby Steps is set to launch later in 2023 on Steam and PS5.

items.title: Madison Square Garden’s surveillance system banned this fan over his T-shirt design
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Frank Miller was banned for life from Madison Square Garden properties after being identified by facial recognition systems.
- The ban was linked to a T-shirt he designed in 2021 that referenced Madison Square Garden CEO James Dolan.
- Miller was not attending a Knicks game, had not been to Madison Square Garden in nearly a decade, and had never purchased tickets himself.
- He was stopped by security at Radio City Music Hall before he could enter for his parents' anniversary concert.
- Madison Square Garden's surveillance practices have previously led to other bans, raising concerns about privacy.

items.title: Judge dismisses Samsung’s smart ring lawsuit against Oura
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Samsung's lawsuit against Oura for patent infringement was dismissed by a judge for lacking concrete evidence.
- Samsung sought a declaratory judgment claiming its Galaxy Ring did not infringe on Oura's patents.
- Judge Araceli Martínez-Olguín ruled that Oura's public statements were insufficient to establish a threat or intent to sue against Samsung.
- The case highlights Samsung's interest in smart rings and reflects common patent disputes in the tech industry.

items.title: Nvidia RTX 5090 mobile GPU: more efficient and a little faster
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The RTX 5090 laptop GPU offers improved efficiency over previous models.  
- It features 24GB of GDDR7 VRAM, more powerful Tensor cores, and slightly more CUDA cores than the 4090.  
- Performance benchmarks showed a 13% higher Geekbench score and 14% in 3DMark over the 4090.  
- In games like *Cyberpunk 2077*, the 5090 was up to 24% faster without ray tracing and DLSS, narrowing to 5% with those features enabled.  
- The GPU has a lower average wattage (by 20-29%) compared to the 4090, improving battery life.  
- The RTX 5090 is priced starting at $4,000, with specific configurations costing more.  
- Continued testing of the RTX 5090 and other 50-series mobile GPUs is expected in upcoming weeks.

items.title: Common Side Effects is coming back for a second season
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Adult Swim's animated series *Common Side Effects* has been renewed for a second season.
- The show follows a man trying to save the world using a mushroom that can cure any illness.
- No release date for the new season has been announced yet.
- Series co-creators Joe Bennett and Steve Hely expressed gratitude for the renewal and their commitment to innovative storytelling.
- Adult Swim president Michael Ouweleen praised the series for its online engagement and genre-defining content.

items.title: Amazon MGM Studios head Jennifer Salke steps down
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Jennifer Salke is stepping down as head of Amazon MGM Studios to focus on producing.
- The decision was announced in an internal memo from Mike Hopkins, who stated the company will not fill her role to flatten the leadership structure.
- Salke joined Amazon in 2018 and played a key role in developing Prime Video's content lineup, including 'The Rings of Power' and 'Fallout'.
- Courtenay Valenti and Vernon Sanders will now report directly to Hopkins following Salke’s departure.
- A separate report indicates Salke’s challenges with the James Bond franchise may have influenced her decision to step down.

items.title: Nintendo’s Legend of Zelda movie hits theaters in March 2027
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the premiere date for the live-action *Legend of Zelda* movie: March 26, 2027.
- The film is directed by Wes Ball, with Shigeru Miyamoto as producer.
- There's limited information currently available about the movie, which was first announced in 2023 following the success of the animated *Super Mario Bros. Movie* that earned over $1 billion.

items.title: WhatsApp users can now add music to their status
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- WhatsApp introduces a new feature allowing users to add temporary music clips to their status updates.
- Music snippets can be up to 15 seconds for photos and 60 seconds for videos.
- The update is rolling out globally and will expand over the coming weeks.
- Users can choose from millions of songs and select specific parts to share.
- Similar features have been added to Instagram and were previously popular on platforms like AIM and MySpace.
- Status updates remain end-to-end encrypted, ensuring user privacy concerning shared songs.

items.title: OpenAI has a Studio Ghibli problem
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Discussion on the creative potential of AI-generated art, particularly in the style of Studio Ghibli.
- The Vergecast episode highlights OpenAI's new image generator in ChatGPT, noted for its power and accuracy.
- Concerns raised about the legal and moral implications of AI-generated content, including potential lawsuits.

items.title: Android Auto’s latest beta brings full Android game support
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Google is introducing gaming support in the latest beta of Android Auto, allowing games like *Candy Crush Soda Saga* and *Angry Birds 2* to be played from car touchscreens.
- Currently, four games are supported: *Candy Crush*, *Angry Birds*, *Farm Heroes Saga*, and *Beach Buggy Racing*, which must be installed on the user's phone and can only be played when the car is parked.
- This update marks the first availability of fullscreen apps in Android Auto, enhancing the experience similar to that on cars with Google built-in. Gaming support was first announced as part of Google's March feature drop.

items.title: Our Favorite Robot Vacuum Deals from Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale features advanced robot vacuums with mopping capabilities.
- Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is available for $999.99, with 10,000Pa suction and sonic mop.
- Roborock S8 Pro Ultra is $899.99, lacks some features compared to MaxV.
- Roborock S8 Plus down to $499.99, offers solid suction and mopping features.
- Dreame X40 Ultra priced at $899.99, features high suction power and self-cleaning.
- Dreame L20 Ultra available for $549.99, offers decent suction and good cleaning capabilities.
- SwitchBot S10 on sale for $459.99, operates as a self-cleaning vacuum and mop hybrid.

items.title: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale Unveils 95 Best Deals Ahead of Prime Day
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon is hosting its Big Spring Sale from now until March 31, 2025, offering discounts on various products.
- Best deals include savings on security cameras, headphones, and smartwatches.
- Discounts may not match those seen during major events like Prime Day, but still significant savings available for all customers, not just Prime members.
- The sale includes competitor price monitoring with discounts from Best Buy, Walmart, and Target.

items.title: Nintendo digital lending feature reveals 'Switch 2 Edition' games are on the way
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nintendo revealed new information about "Switch 2 Edition" games during a recent event not originally focused on the new system.  
- The revelation came after the Nintendo Direct stream, highlighting the upcoming Virtual Game Card lending system.  
- The new system allows digital games to be shared among family members, akin to physical cartridges.  
- Important detail: Only Nintendo Switch 2 systems can load the exclusive and "Switch 2 Edition" games, indicating they won't be backward compatible with previous consoles.  
- The company’s Switch 2 Direct presentation scheduled for April 2nd aims to provide further insights into the new titles and system capabilities.

items.title: Trump White House invites a bloc of conservative podcasters as a jab at legacy media
Amazon’s latest Kindle Scribe is the cheapest it’s been in months
FTC tells staff to stop calling the agency ‘independent’ in complaints
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- FTC staff instructed to stop referring to the agency as 'independent' in complaints.
- Change communicated in a March 21st email from Bureau of Consumer Protection Director Christopher Mufarrige.
- This directive reflects Republican leadership's alignment with Trump’s agenda, following his increased control over the FTC.
- Trump issued an executive order in February allowing the White House to review independent regulatory agencies.
- Trump fired two Democratic commissioners on March 18th, circumventing a Supreme Court precedent on their removal.
- Ongoing lawsuit from the fired commissioners challenges the legality of their dismissals, citing Trump's alleged improper motives.

items.title: Ploopy upgraded its open-source trackball with better scrolling
items.author: Andrew Liszewski

items.title: The 24 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale runs until March 31st, 2025, featuring affordable deals without needing a Prime membership.
- Deals include Glocuscent’s book light at $18, Baseus’ retractable USB-C cable at $10, and various tech accessories and gadgets under $30.
- Notable products highlighted: the Soundcore Bluetooth speaker for $20, a multi-purpose charging hub for $25, and a ChomChom pet hair remover for $20.
- Most products are linked to Amazon for easy purchase.

items.title: Ubisoft's $4 billion carveout sells Tencent a 25 percent stake in some of its biggest games
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Ubisoft is creating a subsidiary for key franchises including *Assassin’s Creed*, *Far Cry*, and *Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six* backed by Tencent.
- Tencent will invest €1.16 billion (~$1.3 billion) for a 25% stake, valuing the carveout at approximately €4 billion (~$4.3 billion).
- This new entity aims to enhance narrative experiences and expand multiplayer content, with the deal expected to close this year.

items.title: The Best MacBook Deals Currently Available
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale features multiple discounts on MacBooks with M-series chips.
- The M1 MacBook Air is available for $649 at Walmart, discontinued by Apple.
- The M2 MacBook Air starts at $749, with various deals offered by Amazon and Best Buy.
- The new M3 MacBook Air is priced starting at $799.
- The latest M4 MacBook Air is available with discounts starting at $949 for the 13-inch variant.
- Refurbished MacBooks are available through Apple at 15-20% off with a one-year warranty.

items.title: Facebook's New Friends-Only Feed Ditches All the Algorithmic Junk
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Facebook introduces a new "Friends" tab that filters out algorithmic recommendations.
- The feature is rolling out in the US and Canada, displaying friends’ stories, reels, posts, and birthdays.
- The platform aims to revive the original social interaction it was known for, which has diminished over the years.
- Users can pin the Friends tab to their navigation bar for easier access.
- Mark Zuckerberg plans to reintroduce several "OG" Facebook experiences throughout the year.

items.title: Bird Buddy’s solar-powered smart feeder is $100 off
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The Bird Buddy Pro smart bird feeder is currently available for $199, down from its usual price of $299.99 as part of Amazon's Big Spring Sale, which runs until March 31st.
- This feeder features an integrated camera that captures 5MP still images and 1080p video, allowing users to identify and observe birds up close.
- The device is solar-powered and comes in blue or yellow, eliminating the need for batteries. It provides bird identification and educational information via a companion app, and a Premium subscription increases the video resolution to 2K.

items.title: Nintendo is paving the way for the Switch 2
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo introduced virtual game cards that allow easy sharing of digital games between devices.
- These cards function like physical cartridges, enabling users to 'eject' and load games on compatible devices linked to their account.
- The feature will be part of a system update expected in April, coinciding with a major Nintendo Direct that may reveal details about the Switch 2 release.

items.title: Fired Democratic FTC commissioners sue Trump
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Two Democratic FTC commissioners, Kelly Slaughter and Alvaro Bedoya, have filed a lawsuit against Donald Trump and current FTC chair Andrew Ferguson.
- They claim their firing violates federal law and Supreme Court precedents established in the 1935 case *Humphrey’s Executor v. US*.
- The lawsuit seeks to restore the commissioners to their positions, arguing they have a right to complete their terms unless there is cause for removal.

items.title: OpenAI says ‘our GPUs are melting’ as it limits ChatGPT image generation requests
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- OpenAI places temporary rate limits on ChatGPT's image generation due to high demand.
- CEO Sam Altman mentioned, "our GPUs are melting" due to the influx of image requests.
- The rate limit aims to manage the stress on OpenAI's infrastructure and improve efficiency.
- Free tier users will soon be able to generate up to three images per day.
- The new image generation tool uses OpenAI's advanced GPT-4o model, offering more realistic creations.

items.title: Satya Nadella: DeepSeek is the new bar for Microsoft’s AI success
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella deployed DeepSeek’s R1 on Azure in January, setting a new benchmark for AI success.
- Nadella highlighted the efficiency of DeepSeek, which operates with a small team and optimized Nvidia's CUDA layer.
- Despite heavy investments and advertising, Microsoft's Copilot app has not achieved comparable success to ChatGPT in the App Store.
- The company is investing $80 billion in AI and data centers to support its AI-focused engineering groups.
- Microsoft aims for every workload to resemble ChatGPT in complexity and performance, while addressing sustainability in its practices.
- Microsoft believes AI can aid in achieving its carbon-negative goal by 2030, despite critics questioning its feasibility.
